data.title: Whitfield County School District
data.text:
Whitfield County Schools (WCS) is excited to announce the launch of its district mobile app, aimed at improving the way the district communicates and engages with students, families, staff and the community.

Northwest Whitfield High School senior Lexi Lyon has been chosen as one of the 69 exceptional Georgia students to participate in State School Superintendent Ricard Woods’ prestigious 2023-2024 Student Advisory Council.

It is with much excitement we announce Westside Middle School has been recognized as a 2023 National Blue Ribbon Exemplary High Performing School by the U.S. Department of Education.

Knowing the fundamental importance of early literacy and students’ ability to read proficiently by third grade, the Georgia Department of Education is recognizing schools with exceptional achievement or growth in third-grade reading as 2022-2023 Literacy Leaders.

Kathy Hammontree, the 2023 Georgia Local Educational Agency (LEA) Representative of the Year, stands as a prime example of what it means to inspire, uplift, and transform lives. Her impressive career spanning over two decades is proof of her commitment to education and dedication to the children and families in her community.
